meanings.definition: An act of breaking or failing to observe a law, agreement, or code of conduct.
meanings.sent1: The company suffered a breach of contract when they failed to deliver the goods on time.
meanings.sent2: The data breach exposed sensitive information to unauthorized users.
meanings.sent3: It was a breach of trust when my friend shared my secret with everyone.
meanings.sent4: The breach in security allowed hackers to access the system undetected.
meanings.sent5: The breach in confidentiality led to a major scandal within the organization.

meanings.definition: A gap in a wall, barrier, or defense, especially one made by an attacking army.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers found a breach in the castle wall and entered stealthily.
meanings.sent2: The breach in the dam caused flooding in the nearby town.
meanings.sent3: The breach in the fence allowed the dog to escape and roam the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The breach in the levee resulted in widespread destruction during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The breach in the wall was a strategic advantage for the invading army.
